article_title: CVS walks away from Chamber of Commerce
article_text:
Early last year, CVS announced unexpectedly that its stores will no longer sell tobacco products . President Obama took note, applauding the company for setting “a powerful example” that will help “reduce tobacco-related deaths, cancer, and heart disease, as well as bring down health care costs.”

By September, CVS followed through, letting the public know it had met its goal one month early

Today, the drugstore chain took yet another striking step along the same lines. The New York Times reported

The CVS Health Corporation said Tuesday that it was resigning from the United States Chamber of Commerce after revelations that the chamber and its foreign affiliates were undertaking a global lobbying campaign against antismoking laws.

article_metadata.description: The business lobby is heavily invested in a pro-tobacco lobbying campaign overseas, prompting the drugstore chain to abandon the Chamber altogether.

article_summary:
The New York Times reportedThe CVS Health Corporation said Tuesday that it was resigning from the United States Chamber of Commerce after revelations that the chamber and its foreign affiliates were undertaking a global lobbying campaign against antismoking laws.
Early last year, CVS announced unexpectedly that its stores will no longer sell tobacco products .
President Obama took note, applauding the company for setting “a powerful example” that will help “reduce tobacco-related deaths, cancer, and heart disease, as well as bring down health care costs.”By September, CVS followed through, letting the public know it had met its goal one month earlyToday, the drugstore chain took yet another striking step along the same lines.
